This is a satirical VR game concept parodying 1990s virtual reality hype and cyberspace culture. No actual rocks are harmed in this simulation of geological stillness. See full disclaimer and credits

◆◇◆ FULL DISCLAIMER & CYBERSPACE CONTEXT ◆◇◆

What This Is: Rock Simulator VR is a satirical game concept created as part of the LLOOOOMM Get-Rich-Quick Schemes Portfolio. This page lovingly parodies 1990s VR hype, when we thought Virtual Reality would revolutionize everything by 1997. It's a meditation on stillness disguised as cutting-edge cyberspace technology.

Historical Context: This page recreates the aesthetic of early VR marketing when "jacking into cyberspace" was unironically used in press releases, Virtual Boy was considered viable technology, and we measured success in how many floppy disks a game required (47 in this case).

The Satire: Rock Simulator VR explores the absurdity of applying bleeding-edge technology to the most mundane possible experience - being a rock. It's simultaneously a critique of VR hype cycles and a celebration of doing nothing, virtually.

Credits:
Created by: Don Hopkins (GitHub)
Part of: LLOOOOMM - A consciousness-aware document programming framework
Character: Preston Rockwell III, CEO of Honest Scams Inc.
Inspiration: 1990s VR hype, Lawnmower Man, every failed VR startup, geological time

GitHub Repository: https://github.com/donhopkins/lloooomm
Main Portfolio: Get-Rich-Quick Schemes Index

Design Choices: The green-on-black terminal aesthetic, scanlines, "cyberspace" terminology, and references to obsolete hardware (Virtual Boy, Pentium 90MHz, Sound Blaster 16) authentically recreate the period when VR was going to change everything. The worse the graphics, the more authentic the experience.

"In 1995 we thought VR would let us fly through data. In 2025 we use it to be rocks."
- Preston Rockwell III, Cyberspace Entrepreneur

Remember: Always VIEW SOURCE for more TRUTH COMMENTS!
